<JD_START>
Job Title: Treasury Management Product Director (2552)

Location: Greater Boston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Other, Product Management

Description:
The Treasury Management Product Director will lead the product team responsible for customer facing Treasury Management products – online/mobile, payments, receivables, account analysis, and referral partnerships. The Director is responsible for shaping the product strategy and roadmap, as well as the development, communication, and implementation of new products and product enhancements. This role is critical in setting the strategic direction of Treasury products following the overall strategy of the Bank. The Director will be held accountable for product revenue growth, profitability, and customer satisfaction and will work closely with Technology and Operations teams, Business Lines, Marketing, and key business stakeholders to deliver and maintain profitable solutions that meet the needs of our clients. This position requires a high level of strategic thinking, but also requires the ability to shift into the details to make informed decisions when required.MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Redesign and optimize product strategy, product roadmaps, and execution/delivery strategies for customer facing Treasury products leveraging insights, data, and customer needs and satisfactionPerform market, competitive, and operating model analysis, drawing insight to support new product development, product enhancements, product sunsetting, and business line initiativesIdentify cost and revenue growth of new products and enhancements, including price recommendationsIdentify risks and regulatory impacts associated with product decisionsIdentify resources necessary to deliver and implement new products and enhancementsContinuously evaluate and assess strategy, performance, and customer satisfaction to improve execution, delivery, and product offerings or exit of productsDevelop customer communication strategy – internal and externalContinuous involvement in industry events, advisory boards, and vendor trainings to further product knowledge and offeringsEnsure optimal customer satisfaction with product offeringsBuild deep relationships and partnerships across the organization to gain alignment on strategy, execution, delivery, support, and communication of productsCollaborate with Technology and Operations teams, Business Lines, Marketing, and key business stakeholders to develop, implement, and promote best-in-class Treasury products and online banking features and servicesLead and develop a team of existing product managersCoach and mentor product managers to develop product management skills and prepare the team for future career advancement opportunitiesDefine clear measurable goals to ensure the team is set up for successEstablish best practices to guide the team with key stakeholder collaboration o Establish team and individual meeting scheduleDevelop product training sessions to train sales teams on new product offerings, product enhancements, and completing formsWork with Human Design/User Experience team to translate requirements into concepts and a functional and intuitive user experience design for online bankingPartner with Digital Product to execute testing and validation of online banking features, functionality, and upgradesMonitor and track product usage and performance, as well as customer satisfactionRegularly gather customer feedback to continuously shape and implement future productsMonitor product pricing and fees for opportunities to reduce costs and increase incomeResponsible for vendor managementGather key stakeholders to review contract renewals and pricing negotiationsReporting and budgetingPrepare monthly reporting of strategic initiativesPrepare annual budget forecast for Treasury Management ProductManage ACD allocations to Business Lines for customer product usageReview monthly department expenses and income to ensure accuracyAnnually, work with Business Lines to review current product pricing and recommended changesImplement pricing changes through Account AnalysisOther product responsibilities, as assigned include, but not limited to:Audit reviews and document gatheringPresentations to support product development and implementationInvoice review and paymentUser Access ReviewsPROBLEM SOLVING & DECISION MAKING:
The Director develops, owns, and executes on Treasury Management product strategy and related product vision.This individual will be responsible for the overall quality and delivery of new products, features, and designs for Treasury Management products, working closely with the Technology teams for online and mobile banking products.Candidate must be able to think strategically and drive results tactically.A key skill will be to merge the competing priorities and constraints across internal stakeholder teams into a thoughtful and detailed roadmap.Candidate will execute product strategy in line with the Organization’s overall strategy ensuring revenue growth, profitability, and customer satisfaction.REQUIREMENTS:
10+ years of experience in Commercial, Business, or Treasury Management banking, product, or technology fields, or an equivalent combination of eachA minimum of 10 years of Treasury Management product development, management, product design or combination of these requirements; 5 years of which can be in Treasury Management salesExtensive knowledge and experience with creating and managing product roadmapsProven track record of executing, delivering, and implementing products that have a clear impact to the businessExperience leading product teams with a proven ability to hire and grow talentExperience working with cross-functional teams and initiativesDeep experience leveraging data to make informed decisions, with a proven ability to set clear and measurable objectivesStrategic mindset with strong analytical skills to bring complex and nuanced concepts into simple actionable tasksSuccessful track record in leading and collaborating with internal and external teamsAbility to “sell” or gain buy-in from across the OrganizationEducation and Experience:
A Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Management, or equivalent combination of training and experienceCertified Treasury Professional or Certified Cash Manager, preferredProduct management experienceSkills/Knowledge:
Metrics driven with a deep understanding of customer needs, as well as the market and competitive landscapeDemonstrated ability to think innovatively with a passion for learning to keep abreast of the latest Treasury Management trendsDeep attention to detail, strong technical skills, well-developed organizational skills, and ability to adapt quickly to changeAbility to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment while working multiple projects at any given timeStrong problem-solving skills with an exceptional ability to prioritize and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job doneExcellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to influence decisions and reach across all levels of the OrganizationExperience with Bottomline Technologies DGBiQ online platform a plusWorking Conditions:
May work remotely, but required to be on-site when necessaryPosition may require occasional evening or weekend hours during product upgrades or testingOccasional travel for industry events

Experience Level (if available): Director
<JD_END>
